meanings.definition: To cause to be out of balance or out of proportion.
meanings.sent1: She misbalanced the seesaw by sitting on one end.
meanings.sent2: The chef misbalanced the flavors in the dish by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent3: The magician misbalanced the deck of cards to perform a trick.
meanings.sent4: His sudden outburst misbalanced the harmony of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake misbalanced the fragile stack of plates on the shelf.

meanings.sent1: The misbalanced scale gave inaccurate readings.
meanings.sent2: The misbalanced load caused the truck to tip over.
meanings.sent3: The misbalanced jenga tower collapsed with a loud crash.
meanings.sent4: Her misbalanced emotions led to a series of poor decisions.
meanings.sent5: The misbalanced bicycle wobbled uncontrollably down the hill.
